meanings.definition: Inphase: in synchronization or alignment with something else
meanings.sent1: The dancers moved inphase with the music, creating a beautiful performance.
meanings.sent2: The two clocks were ticking inphase, showing the exact same time.
meanings.sent3: The birds chirped inphase with the wind, creating a harmonious melody.
meanings.sent4: Her heart beat inphase with the rhythm of the drums, feeling the music in her chest.
meanings.sent5: The students marched inphase, their steps perfectly matching each other.

meanings.definition: Inphase: having the same phase or timing as something else
meanings.sent1: The two waves were inphase, creating a stronger signal.
meanings.sent2: The synchronized swimmers moved inphase, creating a stunning performance.
meanings.sent3: The inphase clocks seemed to be in a secret competition to see who could tick the loudest.
meanings.sent4: Their laughter was inphase, echoing through the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The runners moved inphase, like a well-oiled machine, crossing the finish line together.
